trans-unit.source: Use the policy settings listed in this topic to help you configure built-in and custom settings for enrolled Windows 10 desktop, and Windows 10 Mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: Use the policy settings listed in this topic to help you configure built-in and custom settings for enrolled Windows 10 desktop, and Windows 10 Mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: Intune policy settings for Windows 10 devices in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Intune policy settings for Windows 10 devices in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: This topic contains information to help you to understand the Intune policy settings you can use to manage Windows 10 devices.
trans-unit.target: This topic contains information to help you to understand the Intune policy settings you can use to manage Windows 10 devices.

trans-unit.source: Read this topic alongside the procedures in [Manage settings and features on your-devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies) to configure built-in and custom settings for enrolled Windows 10 desktop, and Windows 10 Mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: Read this topic alongside the procedures in [Manage settings and features on your-devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies) to configure built-in and custom settings for enrolled Windows 10 desktop, and Windows 10 Mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use these policies with PCs that run the [Intune PC client software](/intune/get-started/windows-pc-management-capabilities-in-microsoft-intune).
trans-unit.target: You cannot use these policies with PCs that run the [Intune PC client software](/intune/get-started/windows-pc-management-capabilities-in-microsoft-intune).

trans-unit.source: You can choose from two policy types:
trans-unit.target: You can choose from two policy types:

trans-unit.source: **Custom policy** - Use the Microsoft Intune **custom policy** for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile to deploy OMA-URI (Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier) settings that can be used to control features on devices.
trans-unit.target: **Custom policy** - Use the Microsoft Intune **custom policy** for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile to deploy OMA-URI (Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier) settings that can be used to control features on devices.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 makes many settings available through the [Policy Configuration Service Provider (Policy CSP)](https://technet.microsoft.com/itpro/windows/manage/how-it-pros-can-use-configuration-service-providers).
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 makes many settings available through the [Policy Configuration Service Provider (Policy CSP)](https://technet.microsoft.com/itpro/windows/manage/how-it-pros-can-use-configuration-service-providers).

trans-unit.source: **General configuration policy** - Use this policy type when you want to select settings from the built-in list supplied with Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: **General configuration policy** - Use this policy type when you want to select settings from the built-in list supplied with Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: Supply the following settings in a custom policy:
trans-unit.target: Supply the following settings in a custom policy:

trans-unit.source: Enter a name and optionally, a description for this policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name and optionally, a description for this policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: For each OMA-URI setting you want to add, enter the following information.
trans-unit.target: For each OMA-URI setting you want to add, enter the following information.

trans-unit.source: Use the [Windows 10 URI settings reference](/intune/deploy-use/windows-10-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune#Windows-10-URI-settings) in this topic to learn about the settings you can use:
trans-unit.target: Use the [Windows 10 URI settings reference](/intune/deploy-use/windows-10-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune#Windows-10-URI-settings) in this topic to learn about the settings you can use:

trans-unit.source: **Setting name** - Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.
trans-unit.target: **Setting name** - Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.

trans-unit.source: **Setting description** - Optionally, enter a description for the setting.
trans-unit.target: **Setting description** - Optionally, enter a description for the setting.

trans-unit.source: **OMA-URI (case sensitive)** - Specify the OMA-URI you want to supply a setting for.
trans-unit.target: **OMA-URI (case sensitive)** - Specify the OMA-URI you want to supply a setting for.

trans-unit.source: **Value** - Specify the value to associate with the OMA-URI you entered.
trans-unit.target: **Value** - Specify the value to associate with the OMA-URI you entered.

trans-unit.source: In the screenshot below, the setting **Conectivity/AllowVPNOverCellular** has been enabled.
trans-unit.target: In the screenshot below, the setting **Conectivity/AllowVPNOverCellular** has been enabled.

trans-unit.source: This lets a Windows 10 device open a VPN connection when on a cellular network.
trans-unit.target: This lets a Windows 10 device open a VPN connection when on a cellular network.

trans-unit.source: Example of a custom policy containing VPN settings
trans-unit.target: Example of a custom policy containing VPN settings

trans-unit.source: Use this section to learn about the OMA-URI settings you can configure with a **Windows 10 Custom Policy**.
trans-unit.target: Use this section to learn about the OMA-URI settings you can configure with a **Windows 10 Custom Policy**.

trans-unit.source: **0** - user cannot set the password grace period timer; value is set as “each time”
trans-unit.target: **0** - user cannot set the password grace period timer; value is set as “each time”

trans-unit.source: **1** - user can set the password grace period timer (default)
trans-unit.target: **1** - user can set the password grace period timer (default)

trans-unit.source: **Values:** **0** – Don't allow Internet Sharing, **1** – Allow Internet Sharing (default)
trans-unit.target: **Values:** **0** – Don't allow Internet Sharing, **1** – Allow Internet Sharing (default)

trans-unit.source: **0** – No Wi-Fi connection outside of MDM provisioned is allowed.
trans-unit.target: **0** – No Wi-Fi connection outside of MDM provisioned is allowed.

trans-unit.source: **1** – Adding new network SSIDs beyond the already MDM provisioned ones is allowed (default)
trans-unit.target: **1** – Adding new network SSIDs beyond the already MDM provisioned ones is allowed (default)

trans-unit.source: **0** - VPN is not allowed over cellular
trans-unit.target: **0** - VPN is not allowed over cellular

trans-unit.source: **1** – VPN could use any connection including cellular (default)
trans-unit.target: **1** – VPN could use any connection including cellular (default)

trans-unit.source: **0** – Don’t allow the user to turn Bluetooth on.
trans-unit.target: **0** – Don’t allow the user to turn Bluetooth on.

trans-unit.source: The user can turn on and configure Bluetooth (not supported in Windows Phone 8.1 for MDM, EAS, Windows 10 desktop or Windows 10 Mobile)
trans-unit.target: The user can turn on and configure Bluetooth (not supported in Windows Phone 8.1 for MDM, EAS, Windows 10 desktop or Windows 10 Mobile)

trans-unit.source: The user can turn on and configure Bluetooth (default)
trans-unit.target: The user can turn on and configure Bluetooth (default)

trans-unit.source: Open Extended Dictionary is turned off.
trans-unit.target: Open Extended Dictionary is turned off.

trans-unit.source: -Add a new search integration configuration file
trans-unit.target: -Add a new search integration configuration file

trans-unit.source: Open Extended Dictionary can be added and used by default.
trans-unit.target: Open Extended Dictionary can be added and used by default.

trans-unit.source: Also, the search integration function can be used by default.
trans-unit.target: Also, the search integration function can be used by default.

trans-unit.source: **1** - All Except Shift JIS characters are filtered
trans-unit.target: **1** - All Except Shift JIS characters are filtered

trans-unit.source: **1** - All except JIS0208 characters are filtered
trans-unit.target: **1** - All except JIS0208 characters are filtered

trans-unit.source: **1** - All except JIS0208 characters or EUDC characters are filtered
trans-unit.target: **1** - All except JIS0208 characters or EUDC characters are filtered

trans-unit.source: **0** – Strict, highest filtering against adult content
trans-unit.target: **0** – Strict, highest filtering against adult content

trans-unit.source: **1** – Moderate, moderate filtering against adult content (valid search results will not be filtered - default)
trans-unit.target: **1** – Moderate, moderate filtering against adult content (valid search results will not be filtered - default)

trans-unit.source: **0**: do not defer upgrade (stay in current branch, CB - default)
trans-unit.target: **0**: do not defer upgrade (stay in current branch, CB - default)

trans-unit.source: **1**: Enable updates and upgrades to be deferred (Device follows current branch for business, CBB, rules)
trans-unit.target: **1**: Enable updates and upgrades to be deferred (Device follows current branch for business, CBB, rules)

trans-unit.source: **Description:** Policy to defer software updates for up to 4 weeks
trans-unit.target: **Description:** Policy to defer software updates for up to 4 weeks

trans-unit.source: **1**-**4**: number of weeks to defer software updates.
trans-unit.target: **1**-**4**: number of weeks to defer software updates.

trans-unit.source: **Description:** Policy to defer feature upgrades for up to 8 months
trans-unit.target: **Description:** Policy to defer feature upgrades for up to 8 months

trans-unit.source: **1**-**8**: number of months to defer feature upgrades.
trans-unit.target: **1**-**8**: number of months to defer feature upgrades.

trans-unit.source: **Description:** Allows a device to stop receiving updates and upgrades for 5 weeks.
trans-unit.target: **Description:** Allows a device to stop receiving updates and upgrades for 5 weeks.

trans-unit.source: **1**: Pause updates and upgrades (expires after 5 weeks)
trans-unit.target: **1**: Pause updates and upgrades (expires after 5 weeks)

trans-unit.source: **0** - **90** – Represents what how long malware will be retained
trans-unit.target: **0** - **90** – Represents what how long malware will be retained

trans-unit.source: **Default:** **0** – keeps in the quarantine folder forever, and doesn’t automatically remove
trans-unit.target: **Default:** **0** – keeps in the quarantine folder forever, and doesn’t automatically remove

trans-unit.source: **Values:** **0** – not allowed, **1** – allowed (default) – Also runs when RTP is on if set to allowed
trans-unit.target: **Values:** **0** – not allowed, **1** – allowed (default) – Also runs when RTP is on if set to allowed

trans-unit.source: **0** – Don't check for signatures on an interval
trans-unit.target: **0** – Don't check for signatures on an interval

trans-unit.source: *<list of extensions separated by semi-colon>* E.g.
trans-unit.target: *<list of extensions separated by semi-colon>* E.g.

trans-unit.source: **0**: Disabled (open intranet sites in Edge browser - default))
trans-unit.target: **0**: Disabled (open intranet sites in Edge browser - default))

trans-unit.source: **1** - Enabled (open intranet sites in Internet Explorer).
trans-unit.target: **1** - Enabled (open intranet sites in Internet Explorer).

trans-unit.source: **Values:** **0** – Disabled (DNT not sent - default), **1** – Enabled (send DNT)
trans-unit.target: **Values:** **0** – Disabled (DNT not sent - default), **1** – Enabled (send DNT)

trans-unit.source: **0** – Allow cookies from all web sites (default)
trans-unit.target: **0** – Allow cookies from all web sites (default)

trans-unit.source:
**Values:
**0** – Not configured
**1** – Use IE’s enterprise mode site list if configured (default)
**2** – Specify location of the enterprise site list
trans-unit.target:
**Values:
**0** – Not configured
**1** – Use IE’s enterprise mode site list if configured (default)
**2** – Specify location of the enterprise site list

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Intune **general configuration policy** for Windows 10 to configure built-in settings for enrolled Windows 10 desktop, and Windows 10 Mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Intune **general configuration policy** for Windows 10 to configure built-in settings for enrolled Windows 10 desktop, and Windows 10 Mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the password must be numeric only, or alphanumeric
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the password must be numeric only, or alphanumeric

trans-unit.source: **Required password type** - **Minimum number of character sets**
trans-unit.target: **Required password type** - **Minimum number of character sets**

trans-unit.source: There are four character sets, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.
trans-unit.target: There are four character sets, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.

trans-unit.source: This setting specifies how many of these sets must be included in the password.
trans-unit.target: This setting specifies how many of these sets must be included in the password.

trans-unit.source: **Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped**
trans-unit.target: **Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped**

trans-unit.source: For devices running Windows 10: If the device has BitLocker enabled, it will be placed into BitLocker recovery mode after sign-in fails the number of times you specify.
trans-unit.target: For devices running Windows 10: If the device has BitLocker enabled, it will be placed into BitLocker recovery mode after sign-in fails the number of times you specify.

trans-unit.source: If the device is not BitLocker enabled, then this setting will not apply.
trans-unit.target: If the device is not BitLocker enabled, then this setting will not apply.

trans-unit.source: For devices running Windows 10 Mobile: After sign-in fails the number of times you specify, the device will be wiped.
trans-unit.target: For devices running Windows 10 Mobile: After sign-in fails the number of times you specify, the device will be wiped.

trans-unit.source: **Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off**
trans-unit.target: **Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the length of time a device must be idle before the screen is locked.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the length of time a device must be idle before the screen is locked.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the length of time after which the device password must be changed.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the length of time after which the device password must be changed.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether you want to restrict the end user from creating previously used passwords.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether you want to restrict the end user from creating previously used passwords.

trans-unit.source: **Remember password history** - **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**
trans-unit.target: **Remember password history** - **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of previously used passwords remembered by the device.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of previously used passwords remembered by the device.

trans-unit.source: **Require a password when the device returns from an idle state**
trans-unit.target: **Require a password when the device returns from an idle state**

trans-unit.source: If enabled, the user must enter a password to unlock the device.
trans-unit.target: If enabled, the user must enter a password to unlock the device.

trans-unit.source: Let's the user capture the device screen as an image.
trans-unit.target: Let's the user capture the device screen as an image.

trans-unit.source: Lets the user manually delete the workplace account from the device.
trans-unit.target: Lets the user manually delete the workplace account from the device.

trans-unit.source: **Allow diagnostic and usage data to be sent to Microsoft**
trans-unit.target: **Allow diagnostic and usage data to be sent to Microsoft**

trans-unit.source: **No** - No data is sent to Microsoft
trans-unit.target: **No** - No data is sent to Microsoft

trans-unit.source: **Basic** - Limited information is sent toto Microsoft
trans-unit.target: **Basic** - Limited information is sent toto Microsoft

trans-unit.source: **Enhanced** - Enhanced diagnostic data is sent to Microsoft
trans-unit.target: **Enhanced** - Enhanced diagnostic data is sent to Microsoft

trans-unit.source: **Full (recommended)** - Sends the same data as **Enhanced**, plus additional data about the device state
trans-unit.target: **Full (recommended)** - Sends the same data as **Enhanced**, plus additional data about the device state

trans-unit.source: Lets the user associate a Microsoft account with the device.
trans-unit.target: Lets the user associate a Microsoft account with the device.

trans-unit.source: Lets the user add email accounts to the device that are not associated with a Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: Lets the user add email accounts to the device that are not associated with a Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: Allow device and app settings associated with a Microsoft account to synchronize between devices.
trans-unit.target: Allow device and app settings associated with a Microsoft account to synchronize between devices.

trans-unit.source: Allow the use of the Edge web browser on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allow the use of the Edge web browser on the device.

trans-unit.source: Lets your search engine suggest sites as you type search phrases.
trans-unit.target: Lets your search engine suggest sites as you type search phrases.

trans-unit.source: **Allow sending intranet traffic to Internet Explorer**
trans-unit.target: **Allow sending intranet traffic to Internet Explorer**

trans-unit.source: Lets users open intranet websites in Internet Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Lets users open intranet websites in Internet Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Configures the Edge browser to send do not track headers to websites that users visit.
trans-unit.target: Configures the Edge browser to send do not track headers to websites that users visit.

trans-unit.source: Allows scripts, like Javascript to be run in the Edge browser.
trans-unit.target: Allows scripts, like Javascript to be run in the Edge browser.

trans-unit.source: Allow users to change autocomplete settings in the browser.
trans-unit.target: Allow users to change autocomplete settings in the browser.

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the Edge Password Manager feature.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the Edge Password Manager feature.

trans-unit.source: Specifies where to find the list of web sites that will open in Enterprise mode.
trans-unit.target: Specifies where to find the list of web sites that will open in Enterprise mode.

trans-unit.source: Allow roaming between networks when accessing data.
trans-unit.target: Allow roaming between networks when accessing data.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the device can access VPN connections when connected to a cellular network.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the device can access VPN connections when connected to a cellular network.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the device can access VPN connections when roaming on a cellular network.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the device can access VPN connections when roaming on a cellular network.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether external storage devices such as an SD card can be used with the device.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether external storage devices such as an SD card can be used with the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow the use of Internet connection sharing on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allow the use of Internet connection sharing on the device.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the user can configure their own Wi-Fi connections, or whether they can only use connections configured by a Wi-Fi profile.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the user can configure their own Wi-Fi connections, or whether they can only use connections configured by a Wi-Fi profile.

trans-unit.source: **Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots**
trans-unit.target: **Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots**

trans-unit.source: Lets the device automatically connect to free Wi-Fi hotspots and automatically accept any terms and conditions for the connection.
trans-unit.target: Lets the device automatically connect to free Wi-Fi hotspots and automatically accept any terms and conditions for the connection.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the device can use location services information.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the device can use location services information.

trans-unit.source: Allows the device to use it's Near Field Communications capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Allows the device to use it's Near Field Communications capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Let's this device be discovered by other Bluetooth-enabled devices.
trans-unit.target: Let's this device be discovered by other Bluetooth-enabled devices.

trans-unit.source: Allows devices to receive advertisements over Bluetooth.
trans-unit.target: Allows devices to receive advertisements over Bluetooth.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the user can factory reset their device.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the user can factory reset their device.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether devices can access external storage devices through a USB connection.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether devices can access external storage devices through a USB connection.

trans-unit.source: Configure whether Windows Antitheft mode is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Configure whether Windows Antitheft mode is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the Cortana voice assistant.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the Cortana voice assistant.

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable action center notifications on the device lock screen.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable action center notifications on the device lock screen.

trans-unit.source: All settings are for Windows 10 desktop only.
trans-unit.target: All settings are for Windows 10 desktop only.

trans-unit.source: Enables real-time scanning for malware, spyware, and other unwanted software.
trans-unit.target: Enables real-time scanning for malware, spyware, and other unwanted software.

trans-unit.source: Lets Defender check for certain known patterns of suspicious activity on devices.
trans-unit.target: Lets Defender check for certain known patterns of suspicious activity on devices.

trans-unit.source: The Network Inspection System (NIS) helps to protect devices against network-based exploits by using the signatures of known vulnerabilities from the Microsoft Endpoint Protection Center to help detect and block malicious traffic.
trans-unit.target: The Network Inspection System (NIS) helps to protect devices against network-based exploits by using the signatures of known vulnerabilities from the Microsoft Endpoint Protection Center to help detect and block malicious traffic.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether Defender scans all files downloaded from the Internet.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether Defender scans all files downloaded from the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Lets Defender scan scripts that are used in Internet Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Lets Defender scan scripts that are used in Internet Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Enable this setting to allow Defender to monitor file and program activity on devices.
trans-unit.target: Enable this setting to allow Defender to monitor file and program activity on devices.

trans-unit.source: Lets Defender continue to track resolved malware for the number of days you specify so that you can manually check previously affected devices.
trans-unit.target: Lets Defender continue to track resolved malware for the number of days you specify so that you can manually check previously affected devices.

trans-unit.source: If you set the number of days to **0**, malware remains in the Quarantine folder and is not automatically removed.
trans-unit.target: If you set the number of days to **0**, malware remains in the Quarantine folder and is not automatically removed.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the Windows Defender user interface is hidden from end users.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the Windows Defender user interface is hidden from end users.

trans-unit.source: When this setting is changed, it will take effect the next time the end user's PC is restarted.
trans-unit.target: When this setting is changed, it will take effect the next time the end user's PC is restarted.

trans-unit.source: Lets you schedule a quick scan that occurs daily at the time you select.
trans-unit.target: Lets you schedule a quick scan that occurs daily at the time you select.

trans-unit.source: Lets you schedule a full or quick system scan that occurs regularly on the day and time you select.
trans-unit.target: Lets you schedule a full or quick system scan that occurs regularly on the day and time you select.

trans-unit.source: Lets you limit the amount of CPU that scans are allowed to use (from **1** to **100**)
trans-unit.target: Lets you limit the amount of CPU that scans are allowed to use (from **1** to **100**)

trans-unit.source: Allows Defender to scan archived files such as Zip or Cab files.
trans-unit.target: Allows Defender to scan archived files such as Zip or Cab files.

trans-unit.source: Allows Defender to scan email messages as they arrive on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows Defender to scan email messages as they arrive on the device.

trans-unit.source: Lets Defender scan removable drives like USB sticks.
trans-unit.target: Lets Defender scan removable drives like USB sticks.

trans-unit.source: Lets Defender scan files on mapped network drive.
trans-unit.target: Lets Defender scan files on mapped network drive.

trans-unit.source: If the files on the drive are read-only, Defender will be unable to remove any malware found in them.
trans-unit.target: If the files on the drive are read-only, Defender will be unable to remove any malware found in them.

trans-unit.source: **Scan files opened from network shared folders**
trans-unit.target: **Scan files opened from network shared folders**

trans-unit.source: Lets Defender scan files on shared network drives (for instance, those accessed from a UNC path.
trans-unit.target: Lets Defender scan files on shared network drives (for instance, those accessed from a UNC path.

trans-unit.source: If the files on the drive are read-only, Defender will be unable to remove any malware found in them.
trans-unit.target: If the files on the drive are read-only, Defender will be unable to remove any malware found in them.

trans-unit.source: Specify the interval at which Defender will check for new signature files.
trans-unit.target: Specify the interval at which Defender will check for new signature files.

trans-unit.source: Allow or block the Microsoft Active Protection Service from receiving information about malware activity from devices you manage.
trans-unit.target: Allow or block the Microsoft Active Protection Service from receiving information about malware activity from devices you manage.

trans-unit.source: This information is used to improve the service in the future.
trans-unit.target: This information is used to improve the service in the future.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether files that might require further analysis by Microsoft to determine if they are malicious are automatically sent to Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether files that might require further analysis by Microsoft to determine if they are malicious are automatically sent to Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: This setting can be used to protect enrolled Windows desktop devices against running software classified by Windows Defender as potentially unwanted.
trans-unit.target: This setting can be used to protect enrolled Windows desktop devices against running software classified by Windows Defender as potentially unwanted.

trans-unit.source: You can protect against these applications running, or use audit mode to report when a potentially unwanted application is installed.
trans-unit.target: You can protect against these applications running, or use audit mode to report when a potentially unwanted application is installed.

trans-unit.source: **Files and folders to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection**
trans-unit.target: **Files and folders to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection**

trans-unit.source: Add one or more files and folders like **C:\Path** or **%ProgramFiles%\Path\filename.exe** to the exclusions list.
trans-unit.target: Add one or more files and folders like **C:\Path** or **%ProgramFiles%\Path\filename.exe** to the exclusions list.

trans-unit.source: These files and folders will not be included in any real-time, or scheduled scans.
trans-unit.target: These files and folders will not be included in any real-time, or scheduled scans.

trans-unit.source: **File extensions to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection**
trans-unit.target: **File extensions to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection**

trans-unit.source: Add one or more file extensions like **jpg** or **txt** to the exclusions list.
trans-unit.target: Add one or more file extensions like **jpg** or **txt** to the exclusions list.

trans-unit.source: Any files with these extensions will not be included in any real-time, or scheduled scans.
trans-unit.target: Any files with these extensions will not be included in any real-time, or scheduled scans.

trans-unit.source: **Processes to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection**
trans-unit.target: **Processes to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection**

trans-unit.source: Add one or more processes of the type **.exe**, **.com**, or **.scr** to the exclusions list.
trans-unit.target: Add one or more processes of the type **.exe**, **.com**, or **.scr** to the exclusions list.

trans-unit.source: These processes will not be included in any real-time, or scheduled scans.
trans-unit.target: These processes will not be included in any real-time, or scheduled scans.

trans-unit.source: Enable this setting to allow automatic updates.
trans-unit.target: Enable this setting to allow automatic updates.

trans-unit.source: Then, configure one of the following settings to control update behavior:
trans-unit.target: Then, configure one of the following settings to control update behavior:

trans-unit.source: **Auto install and reboot at maintenance time**
trans-unit.target: **Auto install and reboot at maintenance time**

trans-unit.source: **Auto install and reboot at scheduled time** **Note:** When this option is selected, you can also configure the following settings: **Suppress notification to end user** and **Define install day for scheduled updates**.
trans-unit.target: **Auto install and reboot at scheduled time** **Note:** When this option is selected, you can also configure the following settings: **Suppress notification to end user** and **Define install day for scheduled updates**.

trans-unit.source: Lets Microsoft deploy pre-release settings and features to Windows 10 devices.
trans-unit.target: Lets Microsoft deploy pre-release settings and features to Windows 10 devices.

trans-unit.source: You can select to allow settings only, or all pre-release settings and features to be installed.
trans-unit.target: You can select to allow settings only, or all pre-release settings and features to be installed.

trans-unit.source: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md)
trans-unit.target: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md)
